content.description:
Just right of "Ed chada " cruxes at the 2nd , and 4th bolt. Facey Cruz at second bolt, then thuggy layback crux getting into the chimney. Once inside it's a straight forward chimney maybe 5.8.

Fun safe sport climbing.
content.location: Go to box canyon, the route is right of "Ed Chada"

content.description: Same thin crack start as for Edchada to get onto a big sloping ledge, but then step rightward to go up the long left-facing splitter wide crack, to end as for the rightward tunnel finish for Edchada.  Rated R/X in Bartlett's Central JT book.
content.location: Shiny rap chains out atop the arete via exposed scramble.

content.description: This route is mostly easy hand jamming, with a few tricky finger jam moves.
content.location: The north face of the Drano formation has five cracks.  This is the leftmost one.

content.description: Steep cupped hands and fist crack to climber's right of Jamburger.  Tops out at an alcove with horizontal cracks and natural features way back.
content.location: Easiest way to get to the elevated tight corridor base seems to be rapping down from above, like after finishing Drano, or reversing the walkoff of Drano to gain the top.

content.description: Up the double tiered thin cracks with intermittent hands.  Pull the high roof to continue straight to the top, or pull the roof and tunnel through up and right.  Bartlett's Central JT book shows the rightward exit to be well below the high roof.  Seems actually better to exit that way by pulling over the roof first.
content.location: Shiny rap chains above Zombie Jesus Day, atop the protruding arete to climber's right via exposed scramble, to touch down in the same starting gully.

content.description: This is a high quality splitter finger and flared hand crack, one of the most obvious lines in the Comic Book area.

Go up thin cracks on the left side of flakes to reach a long left-curving crack that continues to a small roof about halfway up.  Cut left at that roof to connect to another left-slanting crack that leads to the top.
content.location: This is the 3rd route from the left on this narrow corridor wall, between Ham & Swiss and Brain Damage.

content.description: Face climb up to the lone bolt, then move right and up to reach thin cracks and flakes to the top.
content.location: This is the right-most route on the narrow corridor wall, to the right of Brain Death.
